title: Data-protection roadblock: Can late entrants Mercedes, Audi capture the connected-cars market?
text:
Mercedes-Benz India has launched its first phase of connected vehicles while the mass segment has already edged past the premium peers. There are challenges on two fronts — the customer’s willingness to pay more for features, and data monetisation. Further, ensuring cybersecurity and customer privacy before incorporating connectivity is significant.
